sub_topic: Identifying the isomorphism between two graphs.
message_1:
Consider the following two graphs: 

```
Graph 1: 
A -- B
|    |
C -- D

Graph 2:
P -- Q
|    |
R -- S
```

Determine if the two graphs are isomorphic or not. If they are isomorphic, provide an isomorphism between the two graphs. If they are not isomorphic, explain why.
message_2:
The two graphs are isomorphic. An isomorphism between the two graphs can be established by mapping the vertices of Graph 1 to the vertices of Graph 2 as follows:

A -> P
B -> Q
C -> R
D -> S

This mapping preserves the adjacency of the vertices, as the edges in Graph 1 (A-B, A-C, B-D, and C-D) correspond to the edges in Graph 2 (P-Q, P-R, Q-S, and R-S) under this mapping. Since the adjacency of the vertices is preserved, the two graphs are isomorphic.
